title: Adaptive Scaffolding Game-Based Learning Course for Medical Emergency Response

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical knowledge and understanding of emergency care procedures
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, linked to real medical simulations for PBL activities. Learners analyze cases and write response strategy reports by teams after gameplay

learning_goals: Learners can rapidly assess patient conditions with over 80% accuracy through medical emergency game scenarios.
With adaptive scaffolding support in-game, learners can explain systematic decision-making procedures in complex emergency situations in three or more steps.
At the end of the 6-month course, learners achieve a knowledge retention rate of 75% or higher between real-time simulated assessments at 2 and 12 weeks.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
